question_text: Who is more likely to benefit from dopamine agonists compared to levodopa?

options.A: Patients with juvenile Parkinsonism

question_text: An elderly patient presented with peak dose dyskinesia that is bothering him and affecting his daily living activities. He is a known case of Parkinson's disease and is maintained on levodopa/carbidopa four times a day. He is doing well otherwise but has a recurrence of the Parkinsonian features just 30 minutes before the next dose. Which of the following is the appropriate management?

options.A: Add Selegiline
options.D: Increase the frequency of levodopa/carbidopa dosing

options.A: MRI of the brain

options.A: Tics

options.A: Clinically

question_text: In a patient with corticobasal degeneration (CBD), what would a PET scan most likely reveal?

options.A: Asymmetrical hypometabolism in the temporal-parietal region
options.B: Hypometabolism in the precentral and postcentral association cortex with asymmetry within the same hemisphere

question_text: What imaging finding is associated with corticobasal degeneration (CBD)?

options.A: Temporal and parietal association involvement

question_text: In a scenario suggestive of Wilson's disease with Parkinsonism and dystonia, what is the recommended treatment?

options.A: Penicillamine
